item.title: Janet Yellen Says U.S., China Making Progress on Managing Economic Tensions
item.description: The Treasury secretary said Washington would listen to Beijing’s concerns on national-security issues.

item.title: Why the Ukraine Counteroffensive Is Such Slow Going
item.description: Outgunned, outmanned and facing a deeply entrenched enemy, Ukrainian troops are attempting one of the most daunting operations a military can undertake.

item.title: Amid Ukraine War and Internal Spats, NATO Seeks Show of Unity
item.description: Summit in Lithuania aims to showcase cohesion against Russia. But fights over Sweden joining and spending levels cast a shadow.

item.title: Last Mile of the Inflation Fight Will Be the Hardest
item.description: Lower housing and used-car costs are expected to push down the core index, but progress could then stall so long as the economy doesn’t weaken.

item.title: Snap's Push to Tempt Creators Seems to Be Working
item.description: Social-media app Snapchat is trying to counter declining sales.

item.title: How to Leave Grandkids Your Retirement Savings---and Not a Huge Tax Bill
item.description: The new rules for inherited IRAs might warrant a rewrite of your estate plan.

item.title: More »
item.description: The food is meh, the decor is bland and parking&#x27;s impossible&#x2014;it&#x27;s the favorite restaurant of America&#x27;s elite

item.title: You're Already Too Late If You Want to Book a Room for the 2024 Eclipse
item.description: Fanatics snap up accommodations for next April’s sensation; a Hilton Garden Inn in Texarkana for $743 a night.

item.title: More »
item.description: How to make money by losing $300,000 a year

item.title: The Professor Helping Guide Billions in Climate Spending
item.description: Jesse Jenkins’s ZERO Lab says that faster upgrades for the power grid are essential to cutting emissions.

item.title: Six People Killed After Small Jet Crashes, Catches Fire in California
item.description: Everybody on board was pronounced dead at the scene. The National Transportation Safety Board and the Federal Aviation Administration are investigating the incident.

item.title: Texas Uses Large Buoys in Effort to Stop Illegal Crossings
item.description: Work began Friday to build a 1,000-foot-long barrier that will float in the Rio Grande.

item.description: Just six weeks after launch, Ron DeSantis&#x27;s presidential campaign looks to have stalled

item.title: Turkey Returns Prisoners to Ukraine, Angering Kremlin
item.description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan last year brokered Russia’s release of five key Ukrainian commanders on the condition they stay in Turkey. Now they are back in Ukraine.

item.title: U.S. Soccer Star Megan Rapinoe to Retire at Year's End
item.description: The 38-year-old, two-time World Cup champion will play this year’s tournament, then finish her NWSL season with OL Reign.

item.title: DeSantis Campaign Stalls as He Tries to Court Trump's GOP Fans and Foes Alike
item.description: The Florida governor’s support is flat in national and early-state polling.

item.title: Major Brazilian River Covered in Toxic Foam
item.description: Drone footage showed parts of a major river in Brazil covered in toxic white foam. Environmentalists said detergent and chemical waste were dumped into the Tietê river in São Paulo state without treatment.

item.title: A Late-Blooming American Springs to Life at Wimbledon
item.description: Christopher Eubanks, 27, was ranked outside the top 100 until this year and used to think grass-court tennis was “stupid.” But with big wins on Friday and Saturday,, he has reached the fourth round.

item.title: U.S. Postal Service Raising Stamp Prices Sunday
item.description: The 3-cent increase is needed to cover rising mail-delivery costs, the USPS said.

item.title: Yellen Presses China for Better Communication to Avoid Economic Risks
item.description: The Treasury secretary says the U.S. and China shouldn’t let disagreements over Washington’s national-security measures further damage ties.
